website_summaries.verdict: Space-saving Sabrent USB hub helps when your desk is too cramped for other options.
pros: The design of the USB hub splits the 7 USB 3.0 ports and 2 charging ports so you can connect accessories and smart devices for charging at the same time
cons: Individual power charging ports require a dedicated 12-volt adapter and a separate wall outlet

customer_reviews.title: Like the form factor, works but has bugs
customer_reviews.text: I really like the standing form factor, had many drive connected. however, if you try to use 2 of the connected drive together, you will loose connectivity to all of them and it will re-mount again. So, if you are copying files form one connected drive to another connected drive, connections will be lost shortly. Both of the charging ports, if I charge 2 device at once, one of them don't work. I charge an ipad and an android phone, the ipad starts beeping(actually the charging song goes on and off, on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Sam W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product and performs as stated. 7-USB ports plus 2 additional USB for charging. Gave 4 stars to the fact that is does not have an off/on button. For applications, like mine in which I have connected under my laptop a fan, the power connector must be connected; and, obviously when powering-off the laptop the fan stays on. The only way to turn-off the fan is by disconnecting the power cord from the hub, which is what I do. Otherwise, it would be 5-stars. Built is sound ans sturdy and comes with a removable base-plate.
customer_reviews.author: SilverGhost

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: I've used this USB hub for three months and have had absolutely no problems. It reliably provides (7) more USB 3.0 ports so as to facilitate a home setup for my laptop. I have an external hard disk hanging off one of the ports and haven't noticed any degradation in transfer speeds. Also, the charging ports are helpful. It's the perfect size, not taking up much desk space.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I really like most everything about this hub. My previous hub was horizontal and presented a wiry mess on my desk with no real means of routing the cables. This one is very clean. The wires coming out the back go quickly out of sight over the desk or they can easily be routed neatly to their destination. The two power ports on the front are very convenient and there are two more USB ports that I use for my small wireless dongles. The only thing I don't like about it is the power supply has a very large footprint and runs the same way as the powerstrip taking up two additional plug spaces. Come on man!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well but......
customer_reviews.text: The hub and charging ports work very well and has a very small footprint on the desktop. However, the hub is extremely light weight and wants to slide all over. A little weight in the stand would probably cure the problem. I attached some small non-skid stick on feet and that help. The packaging was extremely nice. The type of thing you would expect from Apple. Over all it's a good product, but it could use some improvement.
customer_reviews.author: S David

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design of this item. Very disappointing that it doesn't work properly. You cannot use both fast charge ports simultaneously. It will cause both devices to disconnect every 5 seconds. If you want to charge one you have to disconnect the other. Even then, it does not provide enough power to charge a device during use. This thing is just garbage.
customer_reviews.author: GalanSalvius

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hub for travel or home
customer_reviews.text: After putting it off for far too long, I finally got around to purchasing this for a powered USB 3.0 hub along with a new 4TB hard drive to hook up to it. The packaging was simple and effective, installation was easy and common sense, and I had it up and running in no time. The power cord is surprisingly long, adding a great deal of flexibility, although if you're going to fully utilize it you might need to get a USB Cord longer than the one provided. So far, the connections have been extremely stable during heavy read/write and I've not had a single drop-out, even with a WiFi adapter and a second hard drive attached.
customer_reviews.author: Wesgrogan

customer_reviews.title: Very good USB-3 hub
customer_reviews.text: This hub is great! It's small and stands vertical so it has a small footprint on my desktop. Plus it's mountable, so if I decide I don't want it on my desktop I can mount it nearby. And it's fast! I like fast. My USB-3 external hard drive copies files very fast, which is good. With my Acer laptop I do need the external power supply because it's not getting power from the computer. I haven't tried it with a desktop. I wish the two charging ports also did data transfer, because I rarely charge devices this way, but it did charge my phone and bluetooth headset when I tried it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Morton

customer_reviews.title: Solves my input delimina
customer_reviews.text: My laptop only has 3 USB imports. I find I am out of inputs when connecting to my home monitors/keyboard and mouse etc. This was awesome b/c I could plug directly into it and it would power everything. I now have more plugs than I can use. I like the fact it has both rapid and slow charging ports so I can charge my phone quickly. I liked it so much I bought one for my new desk top, it allows for easy access to ports instead of having to struggle to get to the back of the tower and plug/unplug things. Great product and better value.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of 4, amazon only

customer_reviews.title: RIP  This poor baby only lived three months.  RIP
customer_reviews.text: With all your USB 3.0 ports. With all your 12V 4 Amp charging capability. The Amazon Stork brought you to my door such great joy on July 6, 2020. You charged my phone so fast. Never let me down with my data transfers. You were not just my boy. You were my hub. Then just as fast as we made our bond you were gone. October 22, 2020 will be a day not forgotten.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 20160914. I bought two of these. The features ...
customer_reviews.text: 20160914. I bought two of these. The features that interested me were the tower design and the dedicated power ports (red). The units worked out of the box, but they don't work well if left on more than a day or so. I've taken to powering them down every night when I leave my office. Also, Amazon suggests that you buy a USB 3.0 cable, seeming to imply that these don't come with cables. They do, so don't get extras. I have two on my desk I don't need. :-(
customer_reviews.author: William StevensTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Noticed significant drop (>80%) in throughput speed when attaching hard ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible Throughput Speed For Devices! Noticed significant drop (>50%) in throughput speed when attaching hard drives through this hub. There should be minimal throughput decrease. I have purchased another hub, and will be returning this one. UPDATE... I bought 2 other USB 3.0 hard drives (Amazon Basics 10-Port USB 3.0 Hub and Anker USB 3.0 SuperSpeed 10-Port Hub). These other hubs had throughput 5x higher (literally five times faster) than the Sabrent. I tried every port and even different hard drives. Results were the same. This Sabrent hub is very disappointing; I am very surprised by the high ratings... Makes me wonder if the reviews are real.
customer_reviews.author: Smiley25

customer_reviews.title: Steped up to USB 3.0 speeds
customer_reviews.text: Have a few USB 3.0 accessories that were connected to a USB Hub with only 2 USB 3.0 ports and 26 USB 2.0 Hubs. Data transfer rates were too slow so figured I could use a USB 3.0 Hub with 7 ports to make things a little faster. This worked like a charm, plus it gave me two charging ports as an extra. I think I got my monies worth as well as sped up data transfer rates by a large margin.
customer_reviews.author: Beavis

customer_reviews.title: Great hub, mine lasted for five years
customer_reviews.text: Used this hub for five years. Used the ports for multiple radio control and programming. Worked flawlessly here with all seven ports in use. If you hook up several high current demand devices you overload the device. Mine died after five years continuous use and just bought another one. It is a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: practical shopper

customer_reviews.title: Cannot charge ipad and power bank at the same time
customer_reviews.text: I have plugged in only a 2019 ipad and a 6000mha tomax PC5680 power bank to the two red power ports, every few seconds both devices indicate power charging has stopped and then 1 second later it starts charging again, then stops charging again over and over. I can charge one of these devices at a time but not both. Works fine as a USB hub and single charge device.
customer_reviews.author: HCAbrams

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This does what I need it to do at work. I only wish it was made of something heavier (like a metal casing) as sometimes cords and junk on my desk tip it over easily. I can’t permanently affix it to my desk (things always moving around) so that’s a no go. It works for me though and not sorry I got it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: 3.0 is the way to go
customer_reviews.text: Installed this because the computer is not located at their desk. it is 30 ft away and didn't want to run a bunch of USB extender cables for all of the devices. Keyboard, Mouse, and Scanner. Was all plug and play after I installed one 3.0 USB extender cable. No problems after months in use.
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Charging hub with adapter
customer_reviews.text: It is smaller than I realized. However, I am very pleased with the product. I wanted an AC adapter for a USB hub. This has two charging ports for your cell or whatever on the front, as well as two USB connections. The back has additional USB hubs. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Gamomx5

customer_reviews.title: A little clumsy, but works fine
customer_reviews.text: This thing doesn't stand upright like the picture. It always flops over because the weight of the cables is always off balance. So, just plan on throwing away the cute little base. The bigger problem is the power cable seems to fall out of the socket, disconnecting all the peripherals. I wrapped all the cords together with a Velcro strip which keeps all the cables plugged in. I don't know how they would fix the design, as I may have overwhelmed this little device with all but one socket filled. Still, it functions well. The thing I like is the fast charging port for the phone. I can charge my iPhone in about 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable on all ports.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the device because it had a good form factor and it would work well in my setup. The two power ports up front and ports in the back all worked well with it sitting on my desk. But the ports on the back of the unit didn't always work. I had to continue unplugging and re-plugging devices into the top 3 ports in the back to get them to work at time. All in all, I may be looking to replace it so I can have something more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: What I really like about this hub is that it stands up
customer_reviews.text: What I really like about this hub is that it stands up, which makes pugging things into it much easier. I have the side with 5 plugs facing away and tucked under the monitor. I use that for peripherals that are more or less permanent (external drives, scanner, DVD drive), which gets all those wires out of the way, and I still have two in the front for zip drives, etc. The two charging ports are handy too. I was considering mounting it under the desk (hardware for that is included), which would really eliminate the wire clutter, but it looks just fine on top of the desk. Nice to know you have that option, though.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Not USB 3.0.
customer_reviews.text: I like the design, ports on front, ports on back, and two charge-only ports on front -- but this isn't USB 3.0, only USB 2.0. I also have power it off / on when it somehow forgets what I have connected to it.
customer_reviews.author: Just Al

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Fast Charger / Hub
customer_reviews.text: It would be nice if the fast charger ports were also data ports, but the low power ports still work well enough for keeping a phone charged while connected for file transfers. My only real complaint with this hub is that the stand does not securely hold it from sliding out - which is a relatively easy fix with a dab of hot glue or something.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed & Please at the same time
customer_reviews.text: Good hub with great design. After 1 year of use, one of the two front USB data (blue) ports went bad - that's where the disappointment comes in, and it's a biggie due to the need and aesthetic value the 2 devices connected to the front ports. I have to buy another hub due to the issue described. I'm not sure I would trust Sabrent again - these hubs should last a lot longer than 14 months.
customer_reviews.author: Merritt Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little unit
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little unit, very well laid out...no problems so far. I like the inputs on the back (ones I don't have to fiddle with constantly) and the ones on the front were nicely placed there for those inputs that I plug and unplug on occasion, i.e., cell phone, external hard drives, flash drive media, etc.S It provides true 3.0 speeds to all devices that uses it (Windows 10 allows me to verify when transferring data). I'm very, very satisfied and would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great Hub. Don't Wait!
customer_reviews.text: Great hub in a compact form. The charging ports are a bonus. This replaces a multi-port hub that was much larger. Right now I have it attached to the back of my main screen with Command strips. I have the power to a DisplayPort adaptor for my 2nd monitor, a USB 3rd monitor, a 2T external hard drive, a portable scanner and a 256 flash drive plugged into it, all working well, as well as bluetooth adaptors for peripherals. I'm only sorry I hesitated a couple weeks before purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a great charge hub
customer_reviews.text: Its working fine on my MacBook Pro but its not a great charger hub. None of the ports would accept my CD/DVD burner drive. The 2 charge ports only charge and do not connect to the USB bus. Also once you put the base stand on, you cant really get it off! Kind of annoying as I was just testing it to see how it would look and now its stuck. The blue LED ON light is bright and annoying so I covered it with black tape. At this price, I expected more, especially from the non charge ports.
customer_reviews.author: Ian MazurskyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: The first one I got didn't work at all. Exchange was easy and fast. The second one is perfect. Has an indicator light. Plenty of places to plug in USB devices, and is powered. The upright profile is a space saver. I'd buy another if I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: L.A. Marr

customer_reviews.title: Never worked well. Quit working completely.
customer_reviews.text: I've been in IT for 20 years. I say that because often one reads an Amazon review and one thinks, "Well, that reviewer may very well be an idiot." You never know but that maybe someone doesn't like the pants they ordered because they tried to put them on their head. This thing is junk. It never worked well. And then it quit working. It's a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: FLAFarmer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This hub is really cool. It has the high speed and regular USB Ports. I was having problems with my old hubs, so decided it may be time to upgrade. It works great and I am really enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: RayJayTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great USB Hub.
customer_reviews.text: So far this is the best functioning and best looking USB hub I've ever found. Not only is it USB compliant, but it's got two 12volt charging ports which work great for quick charging my phone. The hub not only looks sleek, but feels solid, unlike many cheap flimsy ones I've had. I would definitely recommend this hub to anyone looking for a USB hub.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Big things come in small packages
customer_reviews.text: The hub was smaller than I anticipated but worked out great. I have the hub connected to my keyboard, mouse, webcam, powering my webcam, and external SSD. So far, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Your Name Here

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: This may be more USB hub than one needs. I am very pleased with the purchase. The unit was smaller than I expected (a plus) and the base is removable and also able to be permanently attached to something with two supplied screws. I did not expect that and it could be a cool feature for a mounting option. The semi-silly thing was the packaging. More of what I would expect for a higher end smart phone or a watch. I also like that the transformer is inline, which does not clog up the AC outlet end of things with a big transformer.
customer_reviews.author: Randy E. Chase

customer_reviews.title: no better options.
customer_reviews.text: Got very frustrated with other USB hubs breaking, requiring me to unplug and plug stuff back in, and not supplying my gear with enough power.. This thing does NONE of that. It's very clean looking too, as it doesn't have my cables wildly shooting up in the air like the usual hub does. The only design flaw is a couple upside down ports, but I don't care about that at all. I usually plug in my usb's upside down anyways, so maybe this is even a smart design choice?? I haven't used it's ability to be screwed on a desk or wall. It stays standing perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Less than satisfactory signal processing on all devices.
customer_reviews.text: This Hub does have the ports listed and they work well. Except for the USB 3.0 ports! Unless the device is directly plugged into the USB 3.0 port on the motherboard, the USB 3.0 device does not work like it should. I was unable to get a USB 3.0 external Blu-Ray disk player/writer to work and had to go directly to the USB 3.0 port on the mobo. I have not been able to ascertain how much signal loss occurred on the cable to the hub, but is was enough to make connecting through the hub useless. This is an important matter to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Charles T. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Desk Mountable Hub
customer_reviews.text: I love that this has a base that can be screwed into your desk top. Keeps my USB hub from moving around. Two of the ports on the front are for power only, which is actually really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Wicks

customer_reviews.title: Limited power
customer_reviews.text: We have learned the hard way to limit the power demands on this device. It has a very large power supply. However the actual power delivered to USB devices on the regular ports (not the charging ports) is low. We have smaller hubs with much less powerful supply which support more power to connected USB peripherals. For example connecting a USB HD drive to more than two of the ports on this simply does..not.. work. On a little Amazon Basics USB 3.0 hub - works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: coppersleeve

customer_reviews.title: Plug in all the things!
customer_reviews.text: My Lenovo All-in-one desktop has 4 USB ports...which in this day and age didn't stay unused very long. After plugging in a printer, external hard drive, and Fitbit dongle I found myself having to hot-swap the remaining 3.0 port way too often. Enter this Sabrent 7-port hub. I love all the flexibility offered by that many high speed ports, plus the added benefit of 2 charging ports. Setup was a breeze, and everything I've connected so far was immediately recognized. My wife charged her Fitbit Charge from dead to full in about 20 minutes. That made her happy, which I'm told also made me happy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Fast and tiny, no quick charge.
customer_reviews.text: Like the speed and the slim design. Cable is much too short and had to purchase a longer one. The hub does not lock into the base very well, and just pushing a connector into the hub will cause it to slide out. Otherwise works just fine. Also the orange ports would indicate to me that they support quick charge but sadly they do not.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream with high speed USB 3
customer_reviews.text: Works like a dream with high speed USB 3.0 transfers. My motherboard is set up to allow charging when the computer is shut down and the charging ports of the hub still work. The only problem I have is that I cannot hook up my keyboard or mouse to it because they are not recognized until I have logged onto the operating system (Windows 10) ... which you need the keyboard for.
customer_reviews.author: JPitner

customer_reviews.title: price, quality, and service are all excellent
customer_reviews.text: I love the product. It does everything it claims. The price, quality, and service are all excellent. It is discrete for placement on the desk. I especially like the ability to place it vertical or horizontal. The blue power LED is just the right amount of brightness (softly dim) but I wish the light took up the whole indicator lens and not just a 1/3 of it. I never realized how many USB plugs and gadgets I have. The only thing I would do different is to buy a bigger one! I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: CaD

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great. I'm sharing it between my Mac and Windows ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I'm sharing it between my Mac and Windows PCs using a KVM switch, and I've got more USB slots than I need at the moment, which is so rare. The bottom front ports (the red ones) are charging ports, and I'm genuinely impressed with how fast my iPhone and Windows phones charged from those ports. The base can be screwed down to a table. The screws are small and you can easily snap the heads on them, recommend pre-drilling your holes. I knew better, but was rushing and used a hand screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Riasryn

customer_reviews.title: Not useful for me.
customer_reviews.text: The power supply is not as pictured, the only reason I bought this one is that it doesn't have a wall wart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This Hub kept dropping out
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this drive to work, but the hub kept dropping two external drives. The drive being dropped was my Lightroom working drive.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Rozell

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome USB Hub!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome USB hub. The 2 fast charging plugins are a real good addition as i used to leave my phone charger plugged in all the time to an outlet. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because it doesn't lock in the plugs super tight so when you go to add a new usb device. Sometimes you will hear all of your other devices disconnect and then reconnect. Over all if you have 3 or 4 external hard drives a printer and smart phone, this device will suit you well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Stafford

customer_reviews.title: Sabrent FTW
customer_reviews.text: I've always had great results with Sabrent products. This was no exception. I bought this to replace the USB 2 version I used for years.
customer_reviews.author: Brent L. Bordelon

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away..
customer_reviews.text: purchased this and the 4 port anker usb 3 hub.. I move data between two usb drives, after a while the sabrent locks up and I need to reboot.. no issue at all with the anker. Moved data for house and not one hiccup.. I tried the sabrent again and to no avail... it locked up.. What junk. it however works fine if you only use a usb mouse and keyboard.. lol Update: 10-20-2015 Received message for replacement, got it and it's wonderful.. No issues at all. I must of got a dud? Great support and great product.
customer_reviews.author: Donald P Hohn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little USB 3.0 Hub and charger.
customer_reviews.text: It works great as a hub and charger. I have multiple external hard drives, my lightning cable, and still has space to connect thumb drives without an issue. The charging point easily handle iPad and Samsung Galaxy Tabs, and charge at least as fast as the stock power supplies. My only issue was that it would slide around the side table that I keep it on. I added some stick-on rubber feet and solved that problem right away. Maybe Sabrent will incorporate better feet into a newer version. I am looking to get one of these for work as well.

customer_reviews.title: One of the better USB ports hubs
customer_reviews.text: If you need a USB hub with quick charging this is it. What I like about this is that it's not cheap. Ever use a hub that is so light you feel like it's going to fly off the table by you merely breathing on it? This is not it. It's a high quality port with it's own AC power and easily can be used to charge your USB devices. Well worth the costs and you pay for the quality as much as the thoughtful design.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon W.

customer_reviews.title: Item worked just as described; not my first one but by far my favorite.
customer_reviews.text: Best part is it gets the power through the AC adapter vs the USB port so you don't have to worry about a port not working to its full potential. Only con is no USB-C ports, would be nice to have an hodshed version with 1 or 2 USB-C posts.
customer_reviews.author: Arkadiy Lenchik

customer_reviews.title: Nice to be not warned anymore by Win 7 that I need a USB 3.0 port
customer_reviews.text: Been running for about month now. I have numerous USB 3.0 portable drives hooked up and my Win 7 has stopped reporting 'you could get faster speeds - yada yada'. I didn't buy this unit for the charging ports, but they seem to be quite fast. My only quibble is when I have to plug and unplug, the unit does not stand still. I have to use two hands. Again, it's a quibble, not a deal killer. If I expand beyond the plugging capacity​ of this unit, I'll be getting another.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Using it for a Linux laptop and it works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Using it for a Linux laptop and it works like a charm. I'm constantly moving my laptop between a home office and our family room and I got tired of having to plug-in/unplug a bunch of usb devices (headset, mouse, external hard drive, etc) that I only use in my office. Along with that, my laptop's USB ports are located on both sides (and only 2 are USB 3.0) so I had cables sticking out all over the place. Now I can keep all the cables out of the way and docking/undocking is a snap. The phone charger ports are really handy too. I'd definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry2A

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! It is replacing another fairly new USB 3.0 hub that was giving me problems. I have 2 Western Digital My Passport USB 3.0 hard drives. Even though I was using USB 3.0 throughout the path, any time I plugged both drives into my previous hub, both drives slowed down drastically. If I plugged in only one drive, it worked fine. This Sabrent hub worked perfectly with both drives simultaneously. My drives are running much faster now.
customer_reviews.author: BillM

customer_reviews.title: I BOUGHT TWO OF THEM !
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fabulous. Ordered one for my home office - and then ordered another for my office office. It let's me plug in multiple back up drives - you can never back up photos and financial information enough. I can then use the front ports to charge my phone. And when my clients give me ubs drive with their data, I don't have to crawl under my desk to plug into my computer. ITS ALL ON MY DESK TOP !!. I have recommended to two others since I made my purchase. It's the best thing since sliced bread !
customer_reviews.author: Lilo

customer_reviews.title: Significant Mouse Lag and not USB 3.0
customer_reviews.text: The hub is great for adding ports and apparently charging at a reasonable speed. My problem is that my wireless G602 mouse locks up when the dongle is plugged into the hub. I've taken it out and plugged the dongle directly to the desktop and it works perfectly. Not sure what the problem is. I also only get USB 2.0 speeds with external drives even though the hub is plugged into a USB 3 port.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable Disconnects frequently Bad for external hard drives
customer_reviews.text: the charge is very slow, i do not recommend this if you are planing to connect external hard drives to it, since it disconnects all the time, i don't recommend it either if you are planing to connect mouse and keyboard to it, very unreliable product, i use it to connect my USB keyboard, other then that You better buy an internal PCIe usb hub, this is Garbage i regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Tek

customer_reviews.title: Easy port expansion
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what the description says. Works well and doesn't seem to add any performance issues. Connected a SSD in an USB3 enclosure to my Dell XPS13 and transfers are as fast as when the drive connects to the laptop directly. Only issue was the supplied USB3 cable was quite short, but I had a longer one to use. Table mounting base ensures it doesn't move around because it's quite light. Charging ports work as expected for both HTC and Apple phones.
customer_reviews.author: Daxx

customer_reviews.title: This hub is not working right.
customer_reviews.text: This hub is not working right. The speeds are ridiculous, to the point that i did a test, copying a large file on a thumb drive directly plugged on my computer, it took about 3 minutes. The same file on that hub, speed would go up and down, staying at 0 for a long time, then rising slightly for a few, estimated time: 30 minutes, and I didn't wait for the whole stuff to be done... Even better, I have my Logitech receiver plugged on it too, when that transfer starts, the receiver stops working too, so no more mouse or keyboard. This is not right. Guess I'll have to return this and find one that actually work...
customer_reviews.author: QuarkZ

customer_reviews.title: 7 Porter and the Base Set in Stone
customer_reviews.text: Only slightly cheap packaging, but miles better than anyone else's in this price bracket. Very nice presentation, nice product. Does exactly what it's meant to. The main USB3 connector that goes to the [PC] is a tad loose and will come out if you move the hub around too much. The included base is quite the opposite, if you can either get the base on or back off (if you somehow got it on in the first place) you may or may not be crowned the next king of england.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: It cut off my WIFI to my computer
customer_reviews.text: I had to return it. The device circumvented my WIFI to the computer. I can't work without the internet. I just read another seller's page selling a different Sabrent USB 3 hub with a warning that 2.4Ghz wireless devices such as a wireless keyboard may not work when near the hub. {They recommended using a USB 2 hub instead which is a poor alternative.) Anyway, in my opinion they should place a similar warning on this item. For reference, I have a mac mini which sits on the desk.
customer_reviews.author: Pizza

customer_reviews.title: Upgrading
customer_reviews.text: I bought this USB hub to upgrade my old 2.0 hub. Speed has been great and easy to install. Really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Westward Bound

customer_reviews.title: Beware - this is a 7 month product.
customer_reviews.text: Beware! I ordered one 7 months ago and it worked well, until now. 7 months later is does not work. It provides charging, but does not provide USB connection to my iMac. I tried to return it or get advice on some means of getting a fix, but Amazon simply tells me that I am "beyond the window to return." It worked well enough that I actually ordered a second one for another computer. Now I feel like a fool.
customer_reviews.author: WC Man

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This device is compact yet produces the punch that you want. I love the footprint. It's small and compact. If you are looking for a small, yet hefty USB 3.0 Hub, then you won't go wrong getting this device.
customer_reviews.author: Texasowl

customer_reviews.title: Good at hubbing..  just ok at standing.
customer_reviews.text: Hub was smaller than I expected. The hub itself does its job as well as any USB hub can go, but the base is really crappy. It's way too loose.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Slow poke
customer_reviews.text: slow poke. If i introduce a thumb drive or ssd into this device , it slows down my entire datta transport system to my nvidia shield. DON'T BUY!!!!!!!!! By the way, i do have it plugged into a 120 volt wall socket - ALONE!! I have it plugged directly into my nvidia shield usb port. Thumb drive is also 3.1! I believe this is a 2.0 device.
customer_reviews.author: gentx7x

customer_reviews.title: WOULD NOT recommend, seems to be having a short or something
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hub about 4 months ago and it was decent. . . but now I'm having all kinds of problems with it. My wireless mouse dongle started having weird connectivity problems, my portable hard drives started coming on and off and even the charger on my iphone started flickering on and off. WOULD NOT recommend, seems to be having a short or something. The moment I put all these devices on another hub, everything stabilized. It's too bad, I really liked the form and the idea of it. It fits perfectly in my desk, but it needs to be reliable. If there's a response, I'll update this comment.
customer_reviews.author: S. Strider

customer_reviews.title: The unit works extremely well and I am completely satisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: The unit works extremely well and I am completely satisfied with my purchase. The 2 charging ports charge my phone as fast, if not faster than my wall charger. The transfer speeds are as posted and I have yet to experience any performance impacts. If you are on the fence, I would highly recommend that you purchase this. Edit - I am removing 2 stars because the unit has died.
customer_reviews.author: GrumblyWumbly

customer_reviews.title: Just get it, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the Sabrent 7 Port USB 3.0 HUB. Great quality unit, looks great on my desk, and works as good as advertised. I tried a few other USB hubs, and this is by far the best unit I've used. Didn't run any speed tests, but as far as I can tell, it delivers on the USB 3.0 promise. This is the hub I recommend to all my friends now. Way better than the competition, and at a lower price as well.
customer_reviews.author: @mfkp

customer_reviews.title: I love the form factor on these as well as that ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the form factor on these as well as that they come with pre-drilled holes and screws to be able to attach to the underside of your desk (or anywhere else) if desired. The only oddity of these is that the ports are not oriented all in the same direction. On the front, the two charging ports are oriented upside-down while the data ports are oriented right-side-up. On the back, the data ports are all upside down as well. Not wonky enough to lose a star over, but still a little thing that makes the "which way does the cable go" game a little more challenging.
customer_reviews.author: Gosherm

customer_reviews.title: A compact unit that works great. The high power USBs work great with all ...
customer_reviews.text: A compact unit that works great. The high power USBs work great with all three of my external drives and since it is backwards compatable I use all of my usb devises on it. Works great. I had to reorder it since Amazon lost my first order (multiple things on same order) and the replacement arrived before the original lost order. Nothing but good service (once I found someone at Amazon who spoke English). the supplier was outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design and versatility - one of the few USB ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent design and versatility - one of the few USB 3 hubs that will reliably charge an iPad. MINOR CONS: Charging a device on the bottom red power-only ports (don't connect to computer) will at least sometimes interrupt download from a phone, camera, etc. This seems to affect self-powered devices only. Some printers may print gibberish from time to time instead of a job. Suggest keeping printers off this hub.
customer_reviews.author: MoreBikes

customer_reviews.title: Great 6 Month USB Hub!
customer_reviews.text: This is a phenomenal product! ...while it works. It worked perfectly for about 6 months, until one port stopped working. Then another port went dead a month later, and now a third has stopped working. Unfortunately, it appears to be past the 12 month warranty period. Thus, it is a great, fast, powerful hub while it works, but I can't recommend it at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wasserman

customer_reviews.title: I really liked this unit
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this unit, the power cable that shipped with it was broken though (-1). I had a spare cable of the same type, plugged it in, working great. A week later it stopped working all together. I had a keyboard, mouse, controller and Nexus 4 phone plugged into it - that's it. I had to return it of course. I wish it kept working because I really liked the way it looked and that it was mountable.
customer_reviews.author: EDH

customer_reviews.title: Great but slightly missleading
customer_reviews.text: Love this little usb hub! its great and works well, but the title is a little misleading. The description is 9 usb 3 ports + (and) 2 charging ports. What it should say is 7 usb 3 ports +2 charging ports. The 2 red charging ports are power out only, they do not connect to the computer as a part of the hub. the other 7 ports work as described, with the correct speeds for 3.0 and 2.0 and I say it was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I just updated to El Capitan 10. 11. ...
customer_reviews.text: I just updated to El Capitan 10.11.1 and then the subsequent update to 10.11.3 and now this hub is not working. Anything that I plug into it is not seen my my system. After further examination, the five pots on the back are not working the two front ones are. Edited on 2/5/2016 to give this review 5 starts. I received my replacement hub from Manny today and the new one works perfectly under El Capitan.
customer_reviews.author: M. Romine

customer_reviews.title: ... and the location of my PC was inconvenient for easily connecting USB devices
customer_reviews.text: I had recently reconfigured my desk and the location of my PC was inconvenient for easily connecting USB devices. The Sabrent 9 port USB 3.0 hub provides an easy solution of quickly connecting those devices that need additional power for charging (my phone and tablet) as well as quickly connecting a USB thumb drive without having to crawl under my desk. The device looks good on the desk top and the versatility of using it either vertically or horizontally (with the slide in stand) allowed me to place it were I can most easily reach it. A great device that I recommend to anyone who needs to relocate powered USB ports to their desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Okay but
customer_reviews.text: This is a good hub, but have problems with it reading some flash drive.
customer_reviews.author: Capt_denis

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this USB Hub has created a Driver_State_Power_Failure whenever I try to shutdown my Windows 10 Computer. Only way to shutdown my PC is to disconnect this Hub first which defeats the purpose. I have been satisfied with Sabrent products in the past but this one is a major disappointment. I will need to find something different.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my late 2012 i7 Mac Mini!
customer_reviews.text: I was really struggling to connect all my USB devices to my late 2012 i7 Mac Mini, not anymore and I even have some ports left over. I really like the beefy 4 amp in-line power brick, this rig means business!!! I can now happily connect my 1080p webcam, 4TB external drive, Roland Midi adapter and Canon Printer with ports to spare! I also like the little vertical stand - it's a super neat feature and well thought out.
customer_reviews.author: Derek O

customer_reviews.title: Great stand up design and easy, dependable operation.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is a bit small for 7 USB connectors and cords which tend to pull it in various directions and being very light weight tends to wander off the desk, etc. Guess you could double side stick it but would have trouble reaching the back but the unit works perfectly. Great "stand up" design. 5 Stars Just remember the more you plug in the more it tends to "lean", etc. from the weight of the cables.
customer_reviews.author: Van

customer_reviews.title: I uses these as buffer to support
customer_reviews.text: I uses these as buffer to support for my Laser engraver and 3D printer works great sense both do not support long USB cables.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: it's a nice hub. Plenty of USB ports
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a few months back and wanted to use it for a bit before reviewing it. Overall, it's a nice hub. Plenty of USB ports, and the charging ports really do charge a phone faster than the regular ones. The only issue I've experienced with it so far is that every once in a while the hub will not recognize something plugged into it, and I need to restart my computer before being able to use it again. This has only happened twice since I've bought it though, so not too much of a nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: but it's a boring little piece
customer_reviews.text: Well first off, it's smaller than I thought it would be. And I thought it would be a little more blingy. It just has kinda that one blue light. Other than that it is indeed a USB 3.0 hub that works well. The two charging ports do not pass data, but they sure make my iPad jump when I plug it in. All in all, it does what it's supposed to do, but it's a boring little piece.
customer_reviews.author: E. Brown

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, and time will tell
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, and time will tell. Used a 34 foot usb3 extension cable From our electronics closet to our small desk in the living room. At this point I have got a usb 3 webcam and wireless mouse/ keyboard access points. Everything seems to be working well Even after the long usb3 cable run. Have also used the charging point Have also used the hi speed/ fast charging ports and that also works wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Dave N ANNIE

customer_reviews.title: Was as described for USB 3.0 expansion
customer_reviews.text: It gave me the added space I needed for my various usb items 2.0 and 3.0. This installed without a problem after a reboot of the pc.
customer_reviews.author: steves145

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and Very Convenient.
customer_reviews.text: Using a couple of these USB 3.0 HUB along with a couple of Gigabyte Brix Ultra Compact Mini PC.. They work great and help extend the open USB ports from the mini pc's attached to the back of monitors. No issues with the USB 3.0 ports or charging ports.
customer_reviews.author: RoundTuit

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work with my iMac
customer_reviews.text: I've got a 27" Apple iMac running OS X El Capitan (10.11.3). I ordered this USB hub and plugged it in, when my computer wakes up from sleep, I get the error "Disk not ejected properly." I have checked the Energy Saver settings, and I still continue to get this error for all but one of the ports. Sabrent replaced the hub for free, but the replacement has the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chisler

customer_reviews.title: Happy with unit
customer_reviews.text: I picked up a little Dell PC at a Garage Sale. It didn't have nearly enough USB ports. This must have a controller built in. I have had other units that dropped the first drive when you plug in a second. The only kink so far is with a Kingston thumb drive that it sometimes wont recognize.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Heesacker

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hub and charging unit
customer_reviews.text: This is a awesome hub and charging unit. Its small profile is perfect for a desk
customer_reviews.author: Spencer McAlpine

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Very Small
customer_reviews.text: What a welcome surprise! I was hoping this would be small because I don't have a lot of desk space and it is really tiny; not much bigger than a pack of cigarettes actually! The little base that comes with it fits like a glove and keeps it out of the way too. I probably could have mounted it under the desk top if I wanted. Exactly what I was looking for!!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond M.

customer_reviews.title: THIS USB HUB SUCKS!
customer_reviews.text: Read carefully the complaints of others. I did but disregarded. This hub continuously disconnects from my Mac Pro (Late 2013 model). It also fails to recognize USB 3.0 components and drives plugged into it. Waited to long to return as I was hoping it was a cable issue but it isn't. I would stay with some of the better known products. Now I have to spend good money after bad :-( in short THIS USB HUB SUCKS!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B-63

customer_reviews.title: Plugged it into a USB 3 port and into the wall and SHAZAM!
customer_reviews.text: My LG V10 connects. My wireless keyboard connects. . . . ect. It even charges my FitBit Charge HR via the red charge ports. My only issue with it is that I bought it to help clear the clutter from my desk, but after running it for over a week my desk is still cluttered.
customer_reviews.author: Alan J. Abma

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I am using to connect a Cardioid mic, Web Cam speakers mouse and keyboard to my desktop and laptop one a t a time.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Kramm

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Some parts feel cheep like the stand, plugs in quickly and fully functional. Helped to unclutter my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Marc Baisden

customer_reviews.title: Great USB 3.0 Hub.
customer_reviews.text: I've had problems with other USB 3.0 Hubs but this one works perfectly. The added power supply has plenty of muscle and the two charging ports are nice. The style is very usable and the mounting base works great. The unit looks great too. Anyone with multiple USB devices would love this Hub. It works well with USB 2.0 also.Really great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Burroughs

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have all my USB devices plugged into this hub ( Mouse, keyboard, webcam, 2 external HDDs, etc) and hidden away under my desk having a one cable solution to my PC. This thing is great powers everything with out issues and still gives me excellent speeds. Might buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Gil

customer_reviews.title: Heavy wall-wart + short lead = headaches.
customer_reviews.text: Has a giant heavy wall-wart with a short lead to the unit making it extremely inconvenient to use. If you don;t mind a wall wart sitting on your desk and if you have an outlet close to your desk surface, then you will be fine. If not, prepare for headaches.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Hub Ports Failed After About 6 Months
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about 6 months and then the blue (hub) ports (front and back) stopped powering any connected device. To check if the devices themselves were still working, I plugged the devices directly into the ports on my computer and they all worked fine. Tried the Sabrent again and no dice. Would not recommend this product to others based on my experience. Charging ports still work but I bought the device for the hub connections, not the charging ports.
customer_reviews.author: EngRev

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose- reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Thus far, no issues with this. Granted, I've only used the 3.0 ports, have yet to require the charging ports, but, so far, working as intended. I do wish it came with a velcro strip or something similar as once you plug in the cables, it tends to like to fall over because the weights offset...but, not like that's not something easily rectified.
customer_reviews.author: OTMarine

customer_reviews.title: Convenient.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to extend and augment a USB 3.0 port. I'd rather have this hub in place if any damage would be incurred from badly manufactured connectors instead of on my PC. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

product_meta.title: Sabrent 7 Port USB 3.0 HUB + 2 Charging Ports with 12V/4A Power Adapter [Black] (HB-U930)
product_meta.description:
The Sabrent HB-U930 is a premium 7 Port High Speed USB 3.0 Hub that is designed to maximize compatibility with USB 3.0 devices, including power-hungry USB-powered hard drives, scanners, etc, with its provided 12V/4A power supply. Supplies up to the 1.5A per port and 2.4 amps from the two charging ports 

Hub Controller

The Sabrent HB-U930 features per-port over-current protection to safeguard your connected devices against damage or data loss due to over-voltages. 

Not Just a USB Hub, Also a Fast USB Charger

The Sabrent HB-U930 features two USB fast charging ports that provide high power (2.4 amps per port) under Fast-Charge Mode2. Taking up only one AC outlet, it gives you the ability to simultaneously fast charge two power hungry devices

Compatible Charging Devices (Smart Charging Port Only)
All Apple devices: iPhone 6+/6/5S/5C/5/4/4S, iPad mini 1/2, iPad Air/4/3/2
All Android devices: Samsung Galaxy S5, S4, S3, HTC, EVO, One X; Samsung Galaxy Note
Tablets: Samsung Galaxy Tablets

System requirements:
* Mac OS 9.1 & higher
* Windows XP /Vista /7/8/8.1/10
* Linux 2.4 or above

Package contents
* USB 3.0 hub
* 12V/4A power adapter
* USB cable
* User Manual

Warranty: This product comes with a one year warranty.
In order for us to properly assist you, please follow these simple instructions:
Go to www.sabrent.com/support and click 'Submit a ticket'.
Submit your ticket.
You must include your Amazon Order ID# number in the subject line.
feature_bullets: Instantly Add Seven USB 3.0 Ports + 2 Charging Ports to Any Compatible Device
Features Over-Current Protection Safeguards When Equipment is Connected From Over-Voltages
12V 4 Amp Power Adapter Included to Power up Your Devices
Easy to set up, Plug & Play, Hot Swappable

specifications.Operating System: Windows XP /Vista /7/8/8.1/10; Mac OS 9.1 & higher; Linux 2.4 or above
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars881 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
